oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Effect of Flunixin Meglumine Treatment Following Parturition on Cow Health and Milk Production
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Duffield, T.
Dingwell, H. P.
Skidmore, A.
Weary, D.
Neuder, L.
Rapheal, W.
Millman, S.
Newby, N.
Leslie, K.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: dairy farms
NSAID
calving
well-being
milk production
periparturient disease
reproductive performance
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A double-blind randomized clinical trial was conducted on two Holstein dairy farms: a research facility in Ontario, Canada and a large commercial dairy farm in Michigan. It was hypothesized that a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (Banamine) will reduce pain after calving, thus improving individual cow well-being, and in turn improve milk production, reduce periparturient disease, enhance reproductive performance, and limit early removal from the herd in the subsequent lactation.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2009; 188
